title: [Large-scale] Multimodal Meaning Construction in Science Classrooms: Physics Fundamentals and Social Inquiry for Beginners

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level basic science knowledge, proficiency in using digital learning tools, and foundational understanding of social interaction
context.additional_context: Provides multimodal resources considering linguistic diversity and cultural backgrounds, with asynchronous discussion boards. Emphasizes social relationship building and collaborative problem-solving skills.

learning_goals: Students explain basic principles of physical phenomena (e.g., sound) using multimodal resources (text, diagrams, models) and understand the importance of social collaboration in scientific inquiry.
Students convert experimental results into visual/non-visual symbols following scientific discourse conventions and enhance interpretation skills considering cultural contexts through peer feedback.
Students co-construct scientific meaning via peer feedback and structured guidance on LMS discussion boards and develop critical thinking as responsible citizens.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
